intro: Osmia floribunda, commonly known as the flowering mason bee, is a solitary bee species native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its small size, typically measuring around 10–15 millimeters in length, and its distinctive black and yellow striped body. The plant it pollinates, often a variety of flowering plants, benefits from its efficient pollination habits. Osmia floribunda constructs its nests in pre-existing cavities, such as hollow stems or bee hotels, where it lays its eggs. This species plays a vital role in the ecological balance by contributing to the pollination of various flora.
